topic.title: ECPB Provisioning and De-provisioning

body.p: The ECPB block provides unicast connections between the MAPOTN and ENET subsystems. The ECPB is not a user defined connection point and point to point bidirectional connections through the ECPB will be configured when datapaths that traverse the ECPB are provisioned. Buffer sizing for all applications except sub-rate mapping of ENET to OTN is fixed and defined by the device software. Buffer sizing for sub-rate mapping of ENET to OTN is user defined as an argument to software API.

Use of the ECPB as a loopback point is supported with the g5_api_switch_loopback_set() API. The loopback point is defined by the mode argument of type g5_switch_loopback_t to the g5_api_switch_loopback_set() API. As noted in the g5_switch_loopback_t definition for the mode argument, the point-to-point bidirectional connection through the ECPB is re-established when the ECPB loopback is disabled. See Internal Loopbacks
